result.execSummary:
The defendant Birdia S. McAlister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 12:13 PM Defendant Birdia S. McAlister in court with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant vacated.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  No contest plea to both counts, Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 2 years probation each count, concurrent, with conditions:  $896 costs due to Clerk of Courts by March 6, 2020; restitution to be determined; no sentence credit if revoked.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 31, 2020 at 09:00 am.
